section_title: World Equestrian Center — Wilmington Venue Profile
section_overview: An efficient, fully-indoor show campus in Wilmington, OH that keeps winter circuits moving. Climate-controlled arenas, generous warm-up rings, and tidy in-gates help you stack trips without chaos. Vendor row sits steps from stabling, so grabbing studs, spur straps, or a quick protein bite between classes is easy. Expect regular tractor drags, clear schooling blocks, and a straightforward jog strip—plan your hack windows and keep a ring bag ready.

section_spotlight.title: Quick Hits for Show Week
bullets: Warm-up ring: call your lines early, pass left-to-left, and hand-walk outside peak times to avoid in-gate compression.
Jog strip: arrive polished and early; number visible; keep a rag handy for last-second boot wipe before the jog.
Vendor row: close to stabling—mobile-order or call ahead; keep a mini kit (hairnets, spur straps, gloves) in your ring bag.
Stabling: aisles get busy—trunks flush, hoses coiled; quiet hours respected; lunging only in designated spaces.
Schedule: tractor drags are frequent; build 10–15 minutes of buffer between divisions and check posted schooling blocks.
Logistics: indoor doors create pinch points—dismount and lead at congested entries; allow a few extra minutes in cold snaps.
